value.message: Using logger.error for initialization failure may be too severe if the error is recoverable.
value.suggestion: Use logger.warn or logger.info if the failure is not critical and can be retried or handled gracefully.

value.message: Using logger.error for workflow registration failure may be too severe if the error is recoverable.
value.suggestion: Use logger.warn or logger.info if the failure is not critical and can be retried or handled gracefully.

value.message: Using logger.error for workflow outcome processing failure may be too severe if the error is recoverable.
value.suggestion: Use logger.warn or logger.info if the failure is not critical and can be retried or handled gracefully.

value.message: Using logger.error for workflow start failure may be too severe if the error is recoverable.
value.suggestion: Use logger.warn or logger.info if the failure is not critical and can be retried or handled gracefully.

value.message: Error logging in catch block does not include context information such as input parameters.
value.suggestion: Include relevant context data (e.g., params) in the error log to assist debugging.

value.message: Error logging in catch block does not include context information such as workflow ID or input parameters.
value.suggestion: Include relevant context data (e.g., conversationWorkflow.id) in the error log to assist debugging.

value.message: Error logging in catch block does not include context information such as outcome or workflow IDs.
value.suggestion: Include relevant context data (e.g., outcome.conversationId) in the error log to assist debugging.

value.message: Error logging in catch block does not include context information such as workflow or context details.
value.suggestion: Include relevant context data (e.g., workflow.id, context) in the error log to assist debugging.

value.message: Access control errors in processWorkflowOutcome are only logged, not denied. If an error occurs, the function does not explicitly deny access or halt further processing.
value.suggestion: Ensure that on error, access is denied and no workflows are triggered. Consider rethrowing the error or returning early to prevent unintended access.
